teamMembers.name: Danijela Mišić
teamMembers.title: Naučni savetnik
teamMembers.role: Akreditovana naučno-istraživačka organizacija (NIO): Institut za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković” – Institut od nacionalnog značaja za Republiku Srbiju, Univerzitet u Beogradu (IBISS), Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Beograd, Srbija.
teamMembers.bio: Dr Danijela Mišić je naučni savetnik u Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka IBISS. Na Institutu je zaposlena od 2001. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2001-2004; istraživač saradnik, 2004-2010; naučni saradnik, 2010-2013; viši naučni saradnik, 2013-2018; naučni savetnik, 2018-do danas). Nakon što je diplomirala na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu (BF-UB), magistrirala je (2003. godine) i doktorirala (2009. godine) na istom fakultetu. Bila je na postdoktorskim studijama na Univerzitetu u Vageningenu u Holandiji (2011. godine – šest meseci). Ubrzo nakon što je doktorirala postaje rukovodilac multidisciplinarne istraživačke grupe, koja se bavi istraživanjima u oblastima fiziologije biljaka, specijalizovanog metabolizma, fiziologije stresa, molekularne biologije i genetike biljaka, kao i funkcionalne genomike i metaboličkog inženjeringa. Grupa trenutno broji 14 stalnih članova i prvenstveno je posvećena istraživanju biologije, hemije, ekologije i biotehnologije biljnih vrsta bogatih iridoidima i fenolima. Multidisciplinarni naučni pristup dr Mišić rezultirao je značajnim brojem publikacija u časopisima sa SCI liste (70), poglavljima knjiga (2) i saopštenjima sa nacionalnih i međunarodnih simpozijuma. Kvalitet njenog istraživanja predstavljen je brojem citata (963) i Hiršovim indeksom od 18, prema podacima citatne baze Scopus. Tokom svoje karijere bila je angažovana na osam domaćih i pet međunarodnih projekata. Dr Mišić je uspostavila veoma uspešne saradnje sa uglednim istraživačima iz Srbije i inostranstva (Grčka, SAD, Kina, Iran, Bugarska, Francuska, Holandija, Tajvan, Bosna i Hercegovina). Kao predsednica Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) (od 2017. do danas), dr Danijela Mišić je posvećena umrežavanju i integraciji istraživača iz oblasti biljnih nauka, biotehnologije i poljoprivrede. Tokom protekle decenije, dr Mišić je bila član naučnih i organizacionih odbora uglednih međunarodnih konferencija u organizaciji DFBS. Član je Međunarodnog udruženja za biotehnologiju biljaka (International Association for Plant Biotechnology - IAPB), Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB) i Srpskog Biološkog Društva (SBD). Angažovana je kao saradnik u Centru izvrsnosti za interdisciplinarna istraživanja u biologiji pri IBISS (2020-2024), kao i član Naučnog veća IBISS (od 2013. do danas). Dr Mišić je bila recenzent 20 časopisa sa SCI liste,a  recenzirala je i dva bilateralna projekta za Ministarstvo prosvete, nauke i tehnološkog razvoja Republike Srbije. Trenutno je Koordinator za dodelu stipendija za mlade istraživače (STSM) pri projektu CostAction CA18210 (2019-2023). Bila je angažovana kao mentor tri doktorske i jedne master teze, dok je eksperimentalno doprinela u izradi jedanaest doktorskih i pet master teza.

teamMembers.name: Uroš Gašić
teamMembers.title: viši naučni saradnik
teamMembers.role: Akreditovana naučno-istraživačka organizacija (NIO): Institut za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković” – Institut od nacionalnog značaja za Republiku Srbiju, Univerzitet u Beogradu (IBISS), Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Beograd, Srbija.
teamMembers.bio: Dr Uroš Gašić, viši naučni saradnik, zaposlen je u Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka, na IBISS od 2019. godine (viši naučni saradnik, 2018-danas). Nakon sticanja diplome osnovnih studija na Hemijskom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu (HF-UB), Uroš je završio master studije 2012. i doktorske akademske studije 2017. godine na istom fakultetu. Boravio je na usavršavanju u inostranstvu na Univerzitetu na Malti preko projekta ERASMUS + KA107 (2018. godine, boravak od nedelju dana) i u okviru postdoktorskih studija na Nacionalnom Institutu za Hemiju u Ljubljani (2019. godine - boravak u trajanju od tri meseca). Naučno-istraživački rad dr Gašića pripada oblasti hemije biljnih proizvoda, uključujući i specijalizovane metabolite biljaka i hemiju hrane. Nedugo nakon završetka doktorskih studija, Uroš je postao član istraživačke grupe dr Danijele Mišić na IBISS. Multidisciplinarni naučni pristup dr Gašića, i saradnja sa naučnicima iz Srbije i inostranstva (Norveška, Malta, Slovenija, Hrvatska, Turska), rezultovali su brojnim publikacijama u časopisima sa SCI liste (87), poglavljima u monografijama (2) i saopštenjima sa nacionalnih i međunarodnih simpozijuma. Kvalitet njegovih istraživanja odražava veliki broj citata (1349), kao i H-indeks od 20, prema podacima citatne baze Scopus. Dr Gašić je bio angažovan na tri nacionalna i dva međunarodna projekta tokom svoje karijere. Bio je član Organizacionih odbora domaćih i međunarodnih konferencija, kao što su „51st Meeting of the Serbian Chemical Society and 2nd Conference of Young Chemist of Serbia” 2014. godine, “Identification of Components Using High Result Screening Using Different Software” 2014. godine i “UNIFood” 2018. godine. Član je Srpskog Hemijskog Društva (SHD), Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB). Dr Gašić je bio angažovan kao recenzent od strane 16 časopisa sa SCI liste (ukupno 60 recenzija). Mentor je pri izradi dve doktorske disertacije. Uroš je angažovan pri Komisijama recenzenata u dva časopisa – Biomoleculs i Metabolites. Saradnik je Centra izuzetnih vrednosti za interdisciplinarna istraživanja u biologiji IBISS (2020-2024).

prizes.text: Medalja za pregalaštvo i uspeh u nauci, koju dodeljuje SHD, kao priznanje za doprinos istraživanjima u oblasti hemije hrane, sa posebnim osvrtom na analizu sekundarnih metabolita biljaka (2019. godine)

teamMembers.name: Branislav Šiler
teamMembers.title: naučni savetnik
teamMembers.role: Akreditovana naučno-istraživačka organizacija (NIO): Institut za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković” – Institut od nacionalnog značaja za Republiku Srbiju, Univerzitet u Beogradu (IBISS), Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Beograd, Srbija.
teamMembers.bio: Dr Branislav Šiler, naučni savetnik u Odeljenju za Fiziologiju biljaka, zaposlena je na IBISS od 2005. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2005-2009; istraživač saradnik, 2009-2013; naučni saradnik, 2013-2016; viši naučni saradnik, 2016-2021, naučni savetnik od 2021. godine). Nakon završenih redovnih osnovnih studija na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu, Branislav je 2012. godine završio i doktorke akademske studije na istom fakultetu. Dr Šiler je uspostavio uspešnu saradnju sa istraživačima iz Srbije i iz inostranstva (Iran, Slovenija, Bugarska). Objavio je značajan broj publikacija u časopisima na SCI listi (31), dva poglavlja, kao i veliki broj saopštenja na skupovima od nacionalnog i međunarodnog značaja. Na osnovu podataka sa citacione baze Scopus, publikacije dr Šiler imaju 446 citacija, dok H-indeks citiranosti iznosi 13. Od zasnivanja radnog odnosa na IBISS, dr Šiler je bio angažovan na sedam nacionalnih i šest međunarodnih projekata. Bio je član Naučnih i Organizacionih odbora nacionalnih i međunarodnih konferencija, kao što je “International Conference on Plant Biology & Symposium of the Serbian Plant Physiology Society“ 2011., 2015. i 2018. godine, zatim “Programming for Evolutionary Biology” 2016. godine, kao i konferencija u organizaciji Srpskog Biološkog Društva (SBD). Dr Šiler je bio angažovan kao član ili rukovodilac organizacionih timova projekata popularizacije nauke – Evropska noć istraživača (2014-2015; 2016-2017; 2018-2019). Od 2019. godine predstavnik je IBISS za koordinaciju CITES. Dr Šiler je saradnik Centra izuzetnih vrednosti za interdisciplinarna istraživanja u biologiji IBISS (2020-2024), kao i član Naučnog veća IBISS (2017. – danas). Član je Društva genetičara Srbije, Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS), Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB) i SBD. Bio je recenzent 22 časopisa na SCI listi (63 recenzije). Bio je mentor dve doktorske disertacije. Dr Šiler je član uredničkih odbora časopisa  PLOS ONE i Journal of Medicinal Botany.

teamMembers.title: viši naučni saradnik
teamMembers.role: Akreditovana naučno-istraživačka organizacija (NIO): Institut za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković” – Institut od nacionalnog značaja za Republiku Srbiju, Univerzitet u Beogradu (IBISS), Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Beograd, Srbija.
teamMembers.bio: Dr Slavica Dmitrović (rođena Milivojević), viši naučni saradnik, zaposlena je na Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka, na IBISS-u od 2003. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2003-2004.; istraživač saradnik, 2004-2013.; naučni saradnik, 2013-2019.; viši naučni saradnik, 2019 – do danas). Pre toga, od 2000-2003. godine, bila je zaposlena kao asistent-pripravnik na Katedri za fiziologiju biljaka Biološkog fakulteta, Univerziteta u Beogradu. Diplomirala je 2000. godine na Biološkom fakultetu, Univerziteta u Beogradu (BF-UB). Magistrirala je 2003. godine i doktorirala 2012. godine na istom fakultetu (BF-UB). Objavila je značajan broj radova (18) u časopisima sa SCI liste, kao i u drugim časopisima. Kvalitet njenog istraživanja je merljiv na osnovu mnogobrojnih citacija (120) i H indeksa (7) prema citatnoj bazi Scopus. Tokom karijere učestvovala je na 3 nacionalna i 2 međunarodna projekta. Dr Slavica Dmitrović je član Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB). Učestvovala je u izradi 4 doktorske teze. Trenutno je komentor jednog master rada i učestvuje u eksperimentalnoj izradi jedne doktorske teze. Njene glavne oblasti istraživanja su biohemijske interakcije između biljaka, fiziologija stresa biljaka, molekularna biologija biljaka, biotehnologija, kao i analiza i eksploatacija bioherbicida. Dr Dmitrović je bila uključena u promociju nauke predstavljajući Odeljenje za fiziologiju biljaka, na manifestaciji „Otvorena vrata IBISS-a”,  u saradnji sa timom Noći istraživača (Researchers’ Night ReFocuS 2016-17, H2020-MSCA-NIGHT-2016-722341). Učestvovala je na Međunarodnom sajmu tehnike i tehničkih dostignuća, pod nazivom „Vreme je za nove tehnologije”, u Beogradu, 2019. godine, predstavljajući Institut za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković“ Univerziteta u Beogradu.

teamMembers.bio: Dr Marijana Skorić (rođena Dević), viši naučni saradnik u Odeljenju za Fiziologiju biljaka, zaposlena je na IBISS od 2001. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2001-2005; istraživač saradnik, 2005-2015; naučni saradnik, 2015-2020; viši naučni saradnik, 2020 do danas). Dr Skorić je tokom dve godine radila u farmaceutskoj kompaniji Velefarm u Beogradu. Nakon sticanja diplome osnovnih studija na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu (smer: molekularna biologija i fiziologija) 2000. godine, magistrirala je 2005. i doktorirala 2014. na istom fakultetu. Marijana je boravila na usavršavanju u inostranstvu u Laboratoriji za Farmakognoziju Farmaceutskog fakulteta Aristotelovog Univerziteta u Solunu, u Grčkoj (2005. godine – dve nedelje). Dr Skorić je ostvarila uspešne saradnje sa kolegama iz Srbije i inostranstva (Grčka, SAD). Objavila je značajan broj publikacija u časopisima na SCI listi (25), jedno poglavlje i druge publikacije (saopštenja sa domaćih i stranih konferencija). Prema podacima citatne baze Scopus, publikacije dr Skorić su citirane 240 puta, a H-indeks iznosi 9. Tokom karijere, Marijana je učestvovala na sedam domaćih i četiri međunarodna projekta. Dr Skorić je bila angažovana kao član i/ili predsednik Organizacionog odbora međunarodnih simpozijuma biljne biologije, pod okriljem Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) 2015. i 2018. godine. Član je DFBS i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB). Bila je mentor dve master teze, a doprinela je izradi i tri doktorata i jednog master rada. Trenutno je mentor jedne doktorske teze. Dr Skorić je bila član Komisije za dodelu stipendija za učestvovanje studenata i mladih istraživača na konferenciji “Plant Biology Europe 2020”, čiji je organizator bilo FESPB. Kao vodeći stručnjak za analize RT-PCR, zajedno sa grupom istraživača sa IBISS, bila je uključena u rad laboratorije Instituta za virusologiju, vakcine i serume 'Torlak' na testiranju Covid19.

teamMembers.bio: Dr. Dragana Matekalo (rođena Božić), viši naučni saradnik u Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka, zaposlena je na IBISS od 2007. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2007-2010; istraživač saradnik, 2010-2015; naučni saradnik, 2015-2020; viši naučni saradnik, 2020 do danas). Nakon sticanja diplome osnovnih studija na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu (BF-UB), na istom fakultetu završava master (2005. godine) i doktorske akademske studije (2014. godine). Eksperimentalni deo doktorske disertacija uradila je u laboratoriji za farmakognoziju Farmaceutskog fakulteta Aristotelovog Univerziteta u Solunu, u Grčkoj. Dr Matekalo se bavi biosintezom specijalizovanih metabolita biljaka i njihovom regulacijom na molekularnom nivou, kao i metaboličkim inženjeringom. Multidisciplinarni naučni pristup dr Matekalo i saradnja sa naučnicima iz Srbije i inostranstva (Grčka, Holandija, Nemačka) rezultovali su brojnim publikacijama u časopisima sa SCI liste (16) i drugim publikacijama (saopštenjima na domaćim i međunarodnim simpozijumima). Kvalitet njenih istraživanja prikazuje broj citata (282), kao i H-indeks (9), prema podacima citatne baze Scopus. Bila je član Organizacionih odbora domaćih i međunarodnih konferencija, uključujući simpozijume Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) i TERPNET. Član je Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB). Bila je mentor jedne doktorske disertacije i jednog master rada. Dragana je bila angažovana na manifestacijama promocije nauke, kao što su Noć Istraživača (Marie Skłodowska-Curie akcije), “Drugarijada”, koju organizuje Fondacija Novak Đoković, kao i različite aktivnosti Centra za promociju nauke (CPN). Prevela je na srpski jezik knjigu “Šta biljka zna: vodič kroz svet čula”, autora Danijela Šemovica.

teamMembers.title: viši naučni saradnik

teamMembers.bio: Dr Jasmina Nestorović Živković je viši naučni saradnik na Institutu za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković”, Instituta od nacionalnog značaja za Republiku Srbiju, Univerziteta u Beogradu. Biološki fakultet Univerziteta u Beogradu, koji je upisala školske 2000/2001. godine, na studijskoj grupi Biologija, završila je 2006. godine. Doktorske studije na Biološkom fakultetu u okviru studijskog programa „Eksperimentalna i primenjena botanika“ upisala je školske 2006/2007. godine. Doktorsku disertaciju odbranila je 2013. godine na Biološkom fakultetu, Univerziteta u Beogradu i time stekla zvanje doktora bioloških nauka. Od 2007. godine dr Jasmina Nestorović Živković zaposlena je kao istraživač pripravnik u Institutu za biološka istraživanja „Siniša Stanković“. U zvanje istraživač saradnik dr Jasmina Nestorović Živković izabrana je 2010. godine, u zvanje naučni saradnik 2014. godine, dok je u zvanje viši naučni saradnik izabrana 2021. godine. Objavila je značajan broj publikacija u časopisima sa SCI liste (19), a kvalitet njegovog istraživanja je merljiv i kroz broj citata (232, bez autocitata). Prema Scopus podacima h-index dr Jasmine Nestorović Živković iznosi 8. Dr Jasmina Nestorović Živković je od početka karijere učestvovala u realizaciji četiri nacionalna i pet međunarodnih projekta. Bila je član Organizacionog odbora međunarodne konferencije pod nazivom “3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)“. Takođe je bila aktivno uključena kao član organizacionog tima u projekte promocije nauke kao što su Evropska Noć Istraživača (2018.-2019. i 2020. godine), dok je pre 2018. godine dr Jasmina Nestorović Živković učestvovala u manifestaciji Evropska Noć Israživača kao demonstrator. Dr Jasmina Nestorović Živković je učesnik prvog i drugog Festivala Nauke u Srbiji, takođe je bila i predstavnik Instituta na 63. Međunarodnom sajmu tehnike i tehničkih dostignuća (2019.). Dr Nestorović Živković je član Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (Federation of European Societies for Plant Biology, FESPB).

teamMembers.bio: Dr Tijana Banjanac, naučni saradnik u Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka, zaposlena je na IBISS od 2007. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2007-2010; istraživač saradnik, 2008-2016; naučni saradnik, 2016-). Nakon diplomiranja na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu (FB-UB) upisala je doktorske studije koje je završila 2016. godine na istom fakultetu (FB-UB). Naučno-istraživački rad dr Tijane Banjanac pripada oblasti fiziologije, molekularne biologije, biotehnologije, populacione i evolucione genetike biljaka i obuhvata pre svega proučavanje raznovrsnosti populacija i pojave međuvrsne hibridizacije u okviru roda Centaurium analizom procesa rastenja i sekundarnog metabolizma, kao i upotrebom molekularnih markera. Bila je angažovana kao mentor u izradi dve magistarske teze, a trenutno je mentor jednog doktorata. Kao naučni saradnik, dr Banjanac je uključena u Centar izuzetnih vrednosti za interdisciplinarna istraživanja u biologiji pri IBISS-u (2020-2024). Od 2019. godine rukovodilac je Laboratorije za kulturu tkiva sa pripremnom laboratorijom i sterilnim blokom pri odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka IBISS-a. Od 2020. godine dr Banjanac je rukovodilac Zbirke semena pri istoj ustanovi.  Objavila je 18 radova u časopisima koji se nalaze na SCI listi, autor je ili koautor mnogih drugih publikacija (saopštenja sa međunarodnih i nacionalnih skupova); kvalitet njenog istraživačkog rada merljiv je brojem citata (262) i Hirsch-ovim indeksom od 10, prema SCOPUS bazi citata. Tokom svoje karijere, dr Banjanac je bila učesnik dva domaća i jednog međunarodnog projekta. Član je Evropske federacije udruženja za biljnu biologiju (FESPB), Srpskog društva za fiziologiju biljaka (SPPS) i Društva genetičara Srbije (DGS).

teamMembers.bio: Dr Biljana Filipović (rođ. Nikolić), naučni saradnik u Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka Instituta za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković”, zaposlena je na Institutu od 1. februara 2005. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2005-2009; istraživač saradnik, 2009-2016; naučni saradnik, 2016-). Osnovne akademske studije na  Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu (FB-UB), na studijskoj grupi Biologija, završila je 2004. godine sa prosečnom ocenom 9,25 i ocenom 10 na diplomskom ispitu. Doktorske akademske studije završila je na istom fakultetu (FB-UB) 2015. godine sa prosečnom ocenom 10. Bibliografija dr Biljane Filipović obuhvata 21 naučno-istraživačku publikaciju sa  SCI liste i druge publikacije (saopštenja itd.). Naučni radovi dr Biljane Filipović do sada su na osnovu pregleda citiranosti u bazi podataka Web of Science citirani ukupno 126 puta, dok h-index dr Biljane Filipović iznosi 8 prema Scopus bazi podataka. Dr Biljana Filipović je od početka karijere učestvovala u realizaciji četiri nacionalna projekta (tri projekta osnovnih istraživanja i jednog projekta tehnološkog razvoja finansiranih od strane resornog Ministarstva prosvete, nauke i tehnološkog razvoja Republike Srbije), kao i tri međunarodna projekta. Kao učesnik projekta ReFocus 2.0, sponzorisanog od strane Evropske komisije (H2O2O-MSCA-NIGHT-2018-ReFocuS 2.0-818325), aktivno je doprinosila edukaciji mladih, čime im je na popularan i zanimljiv način predstavljala prednosti bavljenja naukom u Srbiji. Tokom 2018. i 2019. godine dr Biljana Filipović je u okviru manifestacije “Noć istraživača” bila zadužena za organizaciju manifestacije, koja je privukla veliki broj posetilaca svih uzrasta. Osim učešća u organizaciji ove manifestacije, dr Biljana Filipović je neposredno učestvovala u postavci ispred Odeljenja za fiziologiju biljaka 2018. godine. Dr Biljana Filipović je član Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology - FESPB).

prizes.text: Dr Biljana Filipović je dobitnik nagrade Fondacije „Goran Ljubijankić“ za najbolju doktorsku disertaciju iz oblasti molekularne biologije odbranjenu u 2015. godini.

teamMembers.name: Milica Milutinović
teamMembers.title: naučni saradnik
teamMembers.role: Akreditovana naučno-istraživačka organizacija (NIO): Institut za biološka istraživanja “Siniša Stanković” – Institut od nacionalnog značaja za Republiku Srbiju, Univerzitet u Beogradu (IBISS), Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Beograd, Srbija.
teamMembers.bio: Dr Milica Milutinović, naučni saradnik u Odeljenju za Fiziologiju biljaka, zaposlena je na IBISS od 2012. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2012-2013; istraživač saradnik, 2013-2020; naučni saradnik, 2020-). Nakon završenih redovnih osnovnih studija na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu, Milica je 2012. godine završila master studije, a potom 2019. godine i doktorke studije na istom fakultetu. U periodu od 2012. do 2017. godine, dr Milica Milutinović je boravila na The Ohio State University (Kolumbus, Ohajo, SAD) gde je radila eksperimentalni deo doktorske teze i bila uključena u rad Arabidopsis Biological Resource Center. Dr Milutinović je tokom istraživačke karijere uspostavila uspešnu saradnju sa istraživačima iz Srbije i inostranstva (SAD, Nemačka). Milica je autor ili koautor jedanaest radova u međunarodnim časopisima, kao desetak saopštenja sa skupova nacionalnog ili međunarodnog značaja štampanih u izvodu. Na osnovu raspoloživih podataka Scopus baze, naučni radovi dr Milutinović imaju 148 citacija i h-indeks citiranosti 5. Od zasnivanja radnog odnosa na IBISS, dr Milutinović je bila angažovana na jednom nacionalnom i tri međunarodna projekta. Milica je član Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) kao i međunarodnog udruženja The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB). Aktivno je učestvovala u popularizaciji nauke kroz organizaciju postavki u okviru Noći Istraživača (Seventh framework programme for research and technological development - People-2013-Night; „The Road to Friday of Science - ReFocuS” i „The Road to Friday of Science – ReFocuS 2.0”), na „Drugarijadi” koju organizuje Fondacija Novak Đoković i na međunarodnoj manifestaciji „Dan Fascinacije biljkama”, pod okriljem Evropske organizacije za biljne nauke. Zajedno sa grupom istraživača sa IBISS, bila je uključena u rad laboratorije Instituta za virusologiju, vakcine i serume 'Torlak' na testiranju covid19.

prizes.text: Dobitnik nagrade za najbolju poster prezentaciju (2018. godine) na simpozijumu od međunarodnog značaja “3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)“, koje je održano pod potkroviteljstvom DFBS.

teamMembers.bio: Dr Jelena Božunović, naučni saradnik, angažovana je u okviru Odeljenja za fiziologiju biljaka IBISS-a od 2013. godine (istraživač pripravnik 2013-2014; istraživač saradnik 2014-2021; naučni saradnik od 2021 do danas). Nakon diplomiranja na Biološkom fakultetu Univerziteta u Beogradu na istom fakultetu je stekla diplomu mastera (2013.godine) i doktora nauka (2020. godine). Koautor je 9 radova u časopisima sa SCI liste i drugih publikacija, a kvalitet njenih publikacija je prikazan kroz broj citacija (76) i Hiršov indeks 3 na osnovu SCOPUS baze podataka. U toku svoje karijere, dr Božunović je učestvovala na 2 projekta: jednom nacionalnom i jednom međunarodnom projektu. Bila je član Organizacionog odbora konferencije „3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)“ 2018. godine. Član je Evropske federacije za biljni biologiju (FESPB) i Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS). Bila je član komisije za odbranu jedne master teze, a trenutno je mentor jednog master rada i učestvuje u eksperimentalnoj izradi jedne doktorske teze. Jelena je bila lokalni organizator i učesnik brojnih aktivnosti u različitim projektima promocije nauke, kao što su Evropska noć istraživača („Marija Sklodovska Kiri akcije“), Dan fascinacije biljkama biljkama (European Plant Science Organization - EPSO) i Drugarijada (fondacija Novaka Đokovića). Dr Božunović je uključena u rad Centra izuzetnih vrednosti za interdisciplinarna istraživanja u biologiji IBISS-a (2020-2024).

teamMembers.bio: Dr Neda Aničić, naučni saradnik, zaposlena je na Odeljenju za fiziologiju biljaka, na IBISS-u od 2013. godine (istraživač pripravnik, 2013-2015.; istraživač saradnik, 2015-2020.; naučni saradnik, 2021-danas). Diplomirala je 2012. godine na Biološkom fakultetu, Univerziteta u Beogradu (BF-UB). Master studije je završila 2013.  i doktorirala 2020. godine na istom fakultetu (BF-UB). Neda je boravila na usavršavanju u inostranstvu na Institutu za sistematsku botaniku i ekologiju, Univerziteta u Ulmu u Nemačkoj (2014. godine), kao i u laboratoriji za farmakognoziju Farmaceutskog fakulteta Aristotelovog Univerziteta u Solunu, u Grčkoj (2015. godine). Dr Aničić je ostvarila saradnju sa istraživačima iz Srbije i iz inostranstva (Grčka, Nemačka, Iran). Objavila je 11 radova u časopisima sa SCI liste, a kvalitet njenog istraživanja je merljiv na osnovu brojnih citacija (69) i H-indeksa (4), prema citatnoj bazi Scopus. Tokom karijere učestvovala je na jednom nacionalnom i dva međunarodna projekta. Bila je član Organizacionog odbora naučne konferencije „3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)” 2018. godine. Dr Aničić je bila učesnik brojnih projekata sa temom promocije nauke, kao što su Evropska Noć istraživača (Researchers’ Night, Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions), Dan fascinacije biljkama (European Plant Science Organization - EPSO) i Drugarijada (Novak Đoković Fondacija). Trenutno je komentor jednog master rada i učestvuje u eksperimentalnoj izradi jedne doktorske teze. Dr Aničić je saradnik Centra izuzetnih vrednosti za interdisciplinarna istraživanja u biologiji IBISS-a (2020-2024). Član je Društva za fiziologiju biljaka Srbije (DFBS) i Evropskog društva za biljnu biologiju (FESPB).

teamMembers.name: Danijela Mišić
teamMembers.title: Principal Research Fellow
teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organization (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković”-National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS)- Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Danijela Mišić is the Principal Research Fellow at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, and she has been employed at the Institute since 2001 (research trainee, 2001-2004; research assistant, 2004-2010; research associate, 2010-2013; senior research associate, 2013-2018; principal research fellow, 2018-to date). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she earned the MSc (2003) and Ph.D. (2009) degrees by the same faculty (FB-UB), and she was a postdoctorate fellow at the Wageningen University, The Netherlands (2011-for six months). Shortly after receiving the Ph.D. degree, she became a PI of the multidisciplinary research group, working in the area of plant sciences and covering fields of plant physiology, plant specialized metabolism, plant stress physiology, plant molecular biology, functional genomics, metabolic engineering, biodiversity and conservation, plant-biotic interactions, and plant genetics. The group currently numbers 14 permanent members and is primarily devoted to investigating biology, chemistry, ecology, and biotechnology of iridoids- and phenolics-rich plant species. The multidisciplinary scientific approach of dr Mišić's studies resulted in a significant number of publications in SCI journals (70), book chapters (2), and others (conference lectures, proceedings, etc). The quality of her research could be measurable through the number of citations (963) and Hirsch index of 18, according to the SCOPUS citation database. She was engaged in eight national and five international projects during her career. She has a successful collaboration with respectable researchers from Serbia and worldwide (e.g., Greece, USA, China, Iran, Bulgaria, France, The Netherlands, Taiwan, Bosnia and Herzegovina). As the President of the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS) (2017-to date), Dr. Danijela Mišić is devoted to networking and integrating Serbian researchers in plant sciences, biotechnology, and agriculture. For the past decade, Dr. Mišić has participated as a member of the Scientific and Organizing Committees of the respectable international conferences on plant biology organized by SPPS, and of many others. She is also a member of the International Association for Plant Biotechnology (IAPB), The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB), and the Serbian Biological Society. She is engaged as a scientific associate in the Center of Excellence for Interdisciplinary Research in Biology at the IBISS (2020-2024) and a member of the IBISS scientific council (2013-to date). Dr. Mišić has served as a reviewer for 20 SCI Journals and as a reviewer of 2 bilateral projects for the Ministry of Education, Science and Technological Development of the Republic of Serbia. She is currently the Short Term Scientific Missions (STSMs) coordinator for the CostAction CA18210 (2019-2023). She was engaged as a mentor of 3 Ph.D. and 1 MSc theses and experimentally contributed to a total of 11 PhDs and 5 MSc theses.

teamMembers.name: Uroš Gašić
teamMembers.title: Senior Research Associate
teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organisation (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković”-National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS)- Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Uroš Gašić, Senior Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2019 (senior research associate, 2018-to date). After he graduated from the Faculty of Chemistry, University of Belgrade (FC-UB), he got the MSc (2012) and Ph.D. (2017) degrees at the same faculty (FC-UB). He was a Visiting Scholar at the University of Malta through the ERASMUS + KA107 project (2018- one-week study stay) and a postdoc at the National Institute of Chemistry in Ljubljana Slovenia (2019-for three months). His main research areas are plant natural products chemistry, including specialized plant metabolites and food chemistry. Shortly after he got the Ph.D. degree, he became a member of Dr. Danijela Mišić’s research group working in plant sciences and covering fields of plant physiology, specialized plant metabolism, and metabolic engineering. The multidisciplinary scientific approach and collaborations with researchers from Serbia and from abroad (Norway, Malta, Slovenia, Croatia, Turkey), resulted in the significant number of publications in SCI journals (87), book chapters (2) and others (conference lectures, proceedings, etc.), and the quality of his research is measurable through the number of citations (1349) and Hirsch index of 20 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During his career, he was engaged in three national and two international projects. Dr. Gašić has participated as a member of the Organizing committees of the respectable national and international conferences such as „51st Meeting of the Serbian Chemical Society and 2nd Conference of Young Chemist of Serbia” in 2014, Higher Mass Spectrometry Course - “Identification of Components Using High Result Screening Using Different Software” in 2014 and “UNIFood” in 2018. He is a member of the Serbian Chemical Society, The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB), and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS). He has served as a reviewer of 16 SCI Journals (60 reviews). He is engaged as a mentor of 2 PhDs. Dr. Gašić is a member of the Reviewing Committees of two journals (Biomolecules and Metabolites). As a scientific associate, he is engaged in the Center of Excellence for Interdisciplinary Research in Biology at the IBISS (2020-2024).

teamMembers.title: Principal Research Fellow
teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organization (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković”-National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS)- Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Branislav Šiler, Senior Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2005 (research trainee, 2005-2009; research assistant, 2009-2013; research associate, 2013-2016; senior research associate, 2016-to date). After he graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), he earned Ph.D. (2012) degrees at the same faculty (FB-UB). Dr. Šiler has established successful collaborations with researchers from Serbia and abroad (Iran, Slovenia, Bulgaria). He has published a significant number of publications in SCI journals (32), book chapters (2), and others (conference lectures, proceedings, etc.), and the quality of his research is measurable through the number of citations (256, excluding self-citations) and Hirsch index of 12 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During his career, Dr. Šiler was engaged within totally seven national and six international projects. He has participated as a member of the Scientific and Organizing Committees of the respectable national and international conferences, such as “International Conference on Plant Biology & Symposium of the Serbian Plant Physiology Society“ in 2011, 2015, and 2018, “Programming for Evolutionary Biology” in 2016, and Conferences organized by the Serbian Biological Society. Dr. Šiler was actively involved as an Organizing team member or leader in science promotion projects such as European Researchers’ Night (2014-2015; 2016-2017; 2018-2019). Since 2019, he has represented the CITES coordination delegate on behalf of the IBISS. He is also engaged as a scientific associate in the Center of Excellence for Interdisciplinary Research in Biology at the IBISS (2020-2024) and a member of the IBISS scientific council (2017-to date). Dr. Šiler is a member of the Serbian Genetic Society, The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB), the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS), and the Serbian Biological Society. He served as a reviewer of 22 SCI Journals (63 reviews). He was engaged as a mentor of 2 PhDs. Dr. Šiler is a member of the Editorial Boards of two journals (PLOS ONE and Journal of Medicinal Botany).

teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organization (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković” - National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS) - Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Slavica Dmitrović (born Milivojević), Senior Research Associate at the Dept. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2003 (research trainee, 2003-2004; research assistant, 2004-2013; research associate, 2013-2019; senior research associate, 2019 - to date). For three years (trainee assistant, 2000-2003), she was employed at the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade. After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB) (2000), she earned the MSc (2003) and Ph.D. (2012) degrees from the same faculty (FB-UB). She has published a significant number of publications in SCI journals (18) and others (conference lectures, proceedings, etc.), and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (120) and Hirsch index of 7 according to the Scopus citation database. During her career, she was engaged in three national and two international projects. She is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS). She was experimentally contributed to 4 PhDs. She is currently a co-mentor of 1 MSc and experimentally contributes to 1 Ph.D. Her main research areas are plant-biotic interactions, plant stress physiology, plant molecular biology and biotechnology, and the analysis and exploitation of bioherbicides. Dr. Dmitrović was involved in science promotion participating in the event 'Open Doors of IBISS' in cooperation with the Researchers' Night ReFocuS 2016-17 team (H2020-MSCA-NIGHT-2016-722341) and International Fair of Techniques and Technical Achievements, entitled 'Time for New Technologies' (2019).

teamMembers.bio: Dr. Marijana Skorić (born Dević), Senior Research Associate at the Dept. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2001 (research trainee, 2001-2005; research assistant, 2005-2015 (note: For two years she was employed in pharmaceutical company Velefarm, Belgrade); research associate, 2015-2020; senior research associate, 2020-). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB) (2000), she earned the MSc (2005) and Ph.D. (2014) degrees at the same faculty (FB-UB). She was a Visiting Scholar at the Pharmacognosy Laboratory of the Faculty of Pharmacy, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Greece (2005- two weeks study stay). Dr. Skorić has established successful collaborations with researchers from Serbia and abroad (Greece, USA). She has published a significant number of publications in SCI journals (22), book chapter (1), and others (conference lectures, proceedings, etc.), and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (240) and Hirsch index of 9 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During her career, she was engaged within totally seven national and four international projects. Dr. Skorić has participated as the member and/or president of the Organizing Committee of International Conferences on Plant Biology organized by the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS) in 2015 and 2018. She is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the SPPS. She was engaged as a mentor of 2 MSc theses and experimentally contributed to 3 Ph.D. and 1 MSc theses. Currently, she is a mentor of 1 Ph.D. Dr. Skorić was a member of the Grant Evaluation Committee of the FESPB Support Grants for 2020. As a key expert for real-time PCR analyses, she was delegated by the IBISS management to help in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic caused by the SARS-CoV-2, and she was engaged at the Institute for Virology, Vaccines and Sera “Torlak“.

teamMembers.name: Dragana Matekalo
teamMembers.title: Senior Research Associate
teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organization (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković”-National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS)- Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Dragana Matekalo (born Božić), Senior Research Associate at the Dept. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2007 (research trainee, 2007-2010; research assistant, 2010-2015; research associate, 2015-2020; senior research associate, 2020-). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she got the MSc (2005) and Ph.D. (2014) degrees at the same faculty (FB-UB). The experimental part of her Ph.D. research was accomplished at the Pharmacognosy Laboratory of the Faculty of Pharmacy (Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Greece). Her main research area is molecular biology of plant specialized metabolism and its regulation (e.g., the isolation and characterization of genes and enzymes involved in the production of bioactive compounds), and metabolic engineering. The multidisciplinary scientific approach and collaborations with researchers from Serbia and from abroad (Greece, The Netherlands, Germany) resulted in a significant number of publications in SCI journals (16) and others (conference lectures, proceedings), and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (282) and Hirsch index of 9 according to the SCOPUS citation database. She was engaged in two national and two international projects during her career. Dr. Matekalo has participated as a member of the Organizing committees of the respectable national and international conferences, including those organized by the Serbian Plant Physiology Society and TERPNET. She is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS). She was supervising 1 Ph.D. and 1 MSc thesis. As devoted to the science promotion to the general public, Dragana participated in manifestations such as European Researchers’ Night (Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions) and Friendships Games (Novak Đoković Foundation), as well as in various activities of The Center for the Promotion of Science (Serbia). She translated a popular science book “What a Plant Knows: A Field Guide to the Senses” (author Daniel Chamovitz) into Serbian.

teamMembers.bio: Dr. Jasmina Nestorović Živković, Senior Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS - National Institute of the Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade., has been employed at the Institute since 2007 (research trainee, 2007-2010; research assistant, 2010-2014; research associate, 2014-2021; senior research associate, 2021-to date). She has published a significant number of publications in SCI journals (19) and others (conference lectures, proceedings, etc.), and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (232) and Hirsch index of 8 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During her career, Dr. Jasmina Nestorović Živković was engaged within totally four national and five international projects. In 2018, she participated as a member of the Organizing Committee of the '3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)'. Dr. Nestorović Živković was the Institute's presenter at the 63rd International Fair of Technics and Technical Achievements (2019). She is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS). teamMembers.bio: Dr. Tijana Banjanac, Research Associate at the Dpt. Of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2007 (research trainee, 2007-2010; research assistant, 2008-2016; research associate 2016-). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she earned the Ph.D. (2016) degree at the same faculty (FB-UB). Dr. Banjanac's research work belongs to the fields of plant physiology, molecular biology, biotechnology, population, and evolutionary plant genetics. She was engaged as a mentor of 2 MSc theses and is a mentor of 1 Ph.D. thesis. Dr. Banjanac is a scientific associate in the Center of Excellence for Interdisciplinary Research in Biology at the IBISS (2020-2024). Since 2019, she has been the head of the Tissue culture lab with a preparative lab and sterile block at the Department of Plant Physiology of the IBISS. Since 2020, Dr. Banjanac has been the manager of The Seed Collection at the same institution. She published 18 manuscripts in respectable SCI journals and other publications (i.e., conference lectures and proceedings). The quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (262) and Hirsch index of 10, according to the SCOPUS citation database. During her career, Dr. Banjanac was engaged within totally two national and one international project. Tijana is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB), the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS), and the Serbian Genetic Society (DGS).

teamMembers.title: Research Associate
teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organization (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković”-National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS)- Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Biljana Filipović (born Nikolić), Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2005 (research trainee, 2005-2009; research assistant, 2009-2016; research associate, 2016-to date). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she earned the Ph.D. (2015) degree at the same faculty (FB-UB). She published 21 manuscripts in respectable SCI journals and other publications (conference lecturers, proceedings), and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (126) and Hirsch index of 8 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During her career, Dr. Filipović was engaged in four national and three international projects. In 2018 and 2019, Dr. Filipović was actively involved in science promotion by participating as a member of the Organizing Committee of the European Researchers’ Night (Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions). Biljana is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS).

prizes.text: Award of the “Goran Ljubijankić” Foundation for the best doctoral dissertation from the field of molecular biology defended during 2015.

teamMembers.name: Milica Milutinović
teamMembers.title: Research Associate
teamMembers.role: Accredited Scientific and Research Organization (SRO): Institute for Biological Research “Siniša Stanković”-National Institute of Republic of Serbia, University of Belgrade (SRO acronym: IBISS)- Bulevar despota Stefana 142, 11060 Belgrade, Serbia.
teamMembers.bio: Dr. Milica Milutinović, Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2012 (research trainee, 2012-2013; research assistant, 2013-2020; research associate, 2020-). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she earned the MSc (2012) and Ph.D. (2019) degrees at the same faculty (FB-UB). The experimental part of her Ph.D. thesis was accomplished at The Ohio State University (USA), where she was also engaged in the Arabidopsis Biological Resource Center within the DNA distribution and donation working group. Dr. Milutinović has established successful collaborations with researchers from Serbia and abroad (USA, Germany). She published nine manuscripts in respectable SCI journals and other publications (conference lectures, proceedings, etc.). The quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (148, excluding self-citations) and Hirsch index of 5 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During her career, Dr. Milutinović was engaged within totally one national and three international projects. In 2018, she participated as a member of the Organizing Committee of the „3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)“. Milica is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS). Dr. Milutinović was actively involved in science promotion by participating in projects such as European Researchers’ Night (Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions), Fascination of Plants Day (European Plant Science Organization), and Friendships Games (Novak Đoković Foundation). As an expert for real-time PCR analyses, she was delegated by IBISS management to help fight against the COVID-19 pandemic caused by the SARS-CoV-2, and she was engaged at the Institute for Virology, Vaccines and Sera “Torlak“ in Belgrade

prizes.text: Award for the best young researcher (2018) at the “3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)“, awarded by the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS).

teamMembers.bio: Dr. Jelena Božunović (born Boljević), Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2013 (research trainee, 2013-2014; research assistant, 2014-2021; research associate, 2021- to date). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she earned the MSc (2013) and Ph.D. (2020) degrees at the same faculty (FB-UB). She published nine manuscripts in respectable SCI journals and other publications, and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (78) and Hirsch index of 3 according to the SCOPUS citation database. During her career, Dr. Božunović was engaged within totally one national and one international project. In 2018, she participated as a member of the Organizing Committee of the „3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting) “. She is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS). Currently, she is a co-mentor of one MSc and experimentally contributes to one Ph.D. thesis.  Jelena was a local organizer or participant in numerous science promotion activities within projects such as European Researchers’ Night (Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions), Fascination of Plants Day (European Plant Science Organization), and Friendships Games (Novak Đoković Foundation). Dr. Božunović is also engaged as a scientific associate in the Center of Excellence for Interdisciplinary Research in Biology at the IBISS (2020-2024).

prizes.text: FESPB grant recipient (2018) - travel grants for graduate students and young Post Docs for attendance at the Plant Biology Europe (PBE) conference held in Copenhagen, Denmark.

teamMembers.bio: Dr. Neda Aničić, Research Associate at the Dpt. of Plant Physiology of the IBISS, has been employed at the Institute since 2013. (research trainee, 2013-2015; research assistant, 2015-2021;  research associate, 2021-to date). After she graduated from the Faculty of Biology, University of Belgrade (FB-UB), she got the MSc (2013) and Ph.D. (2020) degrees at the same faculty (FB-UB). She was a Visiting Scholar at the Institute for Systematic Botany and Ecology, University of Ulm, Germany (2014), and at the Pharmacognosy Laboratory of the Faculty of Pharmacy, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Greece (2015). Dr. Aničić has collaborated with researchers from Serbia and abroad (Greece, Germany, Iran). She has published publications in SCI list journals (12), and the quality of her research is measurable through the number of citations (75) and Hirsch index of 4, according to the SCOPUS citation database. Dr. Aničić was engaged in one national and two international projects during her career. She participated as a member of the Organizing Committee of the „3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting)” in 2018. Dr. Aničić has participated in science promotion projects such as European Researchers’ Night (Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions), Fascination of Plants Day (European Plant Science Organization), and Friendships Games (Novak Đoković Foundation). Currently, she is a co-mentor of one MSc and experimentally contributes to one Ph.D. thesis. Dr. Aničić is also engaged as a scientific associate in the Center of Excellence for Interdisciplinary Research in Biology at the IBISS (2020-2024). She is a member of The Federation of European Societies of Plant Biology (FESPB) and the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS).

prizes.text: Award for the best student poster presentation (2015) at the “3rd International Conference on Plant Biology (22nd SPPS Meeting) “, awarded by the Serbian Plant Physiology Society (SPPS).
